text: uh uh hi everyone catchy breath Tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
puppy album zigg this is the latest full
length LP for multi genre multim medium
Creator Mariah Rose Pereira AKA poppy an
artist whose career has undergone a lot
of turbulent changes and evolution over
the past eight years both musically and
promotionally for one she's been
focusing more on her music and less on
the medic almost posthuman internet
Persona that helped originally put her
on the map she's also been embracing
more alternative rock and metal
aesthetic since some of the songs on
2018s Mia girl took off in the way that
they did and this has led to Poppy
dropping new metal tracks industrial
metal tracks metal core tracks all with
varying degrees of quality uh usually a
slight pop twist too and in this
transition I can give it to Poppy
because she has certainly kept things
interesting which is why I'm shocked to
say that I think zigg is her weakest
effort yet as she's kind of been
inhabiting this uh heavier sound in a
way I'm actually surprised she's still
going down this road because uh her last
full length LP flux uh was a pretty
clear step down in terms of songwriting
production value and I thought to a
degree that may be because Poppy was not
really seeing as much gas left in the
tank with these heavier sounds maybe
she'd be moving away from the rock
trajectory which ultimately would be
fine because she has dabbled in so many
different genres over the years uh I'm
not really married to her pursuing one
single style or sound really my issue
with this album at the end of the day is
that we have half baked songs really
lackluster production it's kind of
lopsided flow wise and it's a scant
record overall moments like church
outfit for example do bring some heavy
electro-industrial beats some howling
lead Melodies and fuzzed out vocals it's
not a terrible Vibe but it kind of ends
out of nowhere and feels like uh poppy
didn't really know how to finish the
track out or extend it then there's hard
which doesn't really have so many
songwriting issues as much as it has
production issues sonically this track
is just a total Miss it's caked in so
much Distortion and fuzz and effects and
the instrumental is barely legible half
the time the vocals are mixed so
aggressively they kind of overtake
everything and I will give it to the
track does feel a little surreal when
these uh very washed out synths envelop
the mix for a few moments but uh still
it just kind of feels like an unfinished
demo and that's not the only moment on
the album that sounds rough in an
unflattering way the passages of buzzing
autotune filth uh during a few points of
the closing track prove it come to mind
it just kind of sounds like poppy is
trying to sound weird and edgy on this
one and obliterates whatever appeal this
track may have had as like a ballad the
song flicker is well gives us more
alternative sounding production when
really the uh squish down distorted
elements in the instrumental just kind
of make the whole things sound very
colorless and flat and just not Dynamic
meanwhile the attic sounds even more
fried and sunburnt than flicker the
breake Beats on this one are kind of
uninspired too between the half-hearted
vocals occasional glitch and basic break
beats on this one I just struggle to
find where the strength in this track
lies which I also struggle with on Cuts
where even the production is clearer
like on what it becomes for example
where the lyrical theme and focus of
this one is uh clearly imagining
somebody being at a point where they're
realizing they no longer have you
anymore whoever you're going to complain
to whoever keeps you company uh one day
you'll see it won't be me which I get as
a concept but the whole track feels more
like a repetitive Mantra than a song and
given the very short length that this
album lasts already uh really should be
all killer no filler then there's the
title track which I think has the
pleasure of featuring the worst chorus
on any poppy album ever the when you
zigzag when you Zig iag bits just kind
of don't seem like her best writing to
date plus the Hideous dissonant
background harmonies that build up
underneath it just make it unlistenable
the best moments on this record honestly
are the most unlikely for poppy at this
point in her career there's knockoff
which is just a pretty straightforward
love Anthem with dark base skipping
Electro grooves it's sensual it's cute
and a little edgy too it works ones and
zeros is a pretty patient Art Pop number
that feels like a combination of a buk
and also some solo Haley Williams
lyrically we also get these recurring
themes of love and acceptance and safety
meanwhile motorbike is a dark dance pop
Banger that I think fans of Charlie XCX
and also maybe Rosalia will go crazy for
it's a song all about a girl that
Poppy's kind of idolizing cuz she's cool
and strong and free and looking badass
on a motorcycle girl on a motorbike what

best moments on this project are not the

oriented moments none of that stuff
they're they're the poppiest cuts which
maybe that's the way forward for poppy
from this point if she did that wouldn't

musically and lyrically and
